10. Alexander CairncrOSS. This remarkable person was Bishop of Brechin only for a few months, having been translated to Glasgow in December, 1684. After the Revolution he was made Bishop of Raphoe by King William, and held the Bishop- rick from 1693 to 1701-the only instance of such promotion after the abolition of Episcopacy in Scotland.
